hackathon-eligibility: All currently enrolled undergraduate and graduate students or recent December 2017 college graduates. Valid student ID required at check-in. Max 4 per team.
hackathon-rules:
As a Major League Hacking member event, Hack@CEWIT is adopting 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Original: Move fast, break things

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: en·tre·pre·neur·ship  äntrəprəˈnərˌSHip  noun  the activity of setting up a business or businesses, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit.  Entrepreneurship, at its core, is a mindset, a way of thinking and acting. It is about imagining new ways to solve problems and create value. Successful entrepreneurs on the Hack@CEWIT judging panel will make their pick of the project that best aligns with this vision.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Entrepreneur's Choice: Identify a need, any need, and fill it

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: health-con·scious adjective having an active interest in one's health.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Health-Conscious: Tech for Healthcare's Sake

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Hack@CEWIT host sponsor, Softheon, takes their pick of the hack that exhibits the most significant use of Softheon payment, identity, and/or data services API.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Softheon's Pick: Best Use of Softheon APIs

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: In this challenge, teams will be asked to utilize Northwell proprietary and public APIs to create a friendly patient or provider experience for reviewing patient health records. Develop a friendly UI that makes Patient Data more accessible and easily navigated and you'll win $1,000 and a VIP tour of the Northwell Innovation Center and one-on-one time with Vish Anantraman - Northwell's Chief Innovation Officer.

Do you ever make a doctor's appointment only to skip it? Why do people not show up to their own health care appointments? Is it the weather? The distance? Traffic? We'll give you a large data set on no-show appointments. Your goal is to help us predict which appointments are likely to be missed. Develop a model and you'll win $1,000 and a VIP tour of the Northwell Innovation Center and one-on-one time with Vish Anantraman - Northwell's Chief Innovation Officer.
Our friends at Cisco are awarding Meraki APs for the top 3 teams plus a special intro to a Cisco App Developer Partner for 1 lucky team!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Cisco's Pick: Best Use of Cisco APIs

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Our friends at 1010data are awarding a team of their choice a Sonos Play:1 Speaker for the best data visualization in the house.

Our friends at VR World NYC, the world's largest virtual reality entertainment destination showcasing over 50 unique experiences from art and film to gaming and multiplayer features, are awarding day passes for the top team + VR World swag for the runner-up!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=CEWIT, 1500 Stony Brook Rd, Stony Brook, NY 11790, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Innovation - The most innovative apps are new concepts that solve a problem in a unique way with new features.
User Interface / User Experience - The best apps are intuitive, visually appealing, and designed for the intended user.
Overall Quality - The best apps are aligned with system design and software engineering best practices and are well polished.
Technical Complexity - The best apps have a sophisticated design.
Quality of Pitch / Project Impact - The best apps have a clear business potential or broad impact (e.g., social, educational, etc.).
